text: Neat programmer - fast programmer
author: Bill Gates

text: Today you make the code, tomorrow the code makes you money
author: Steve Jobs

text: If your code works, then this is good code
author: Markus Persson

text: To understand the mid lane code, you need to be mid. To understand the senior lane code, you just need to be a junior
author: Gabe Logan Newell

text: Every language has a lifetime. Except for Kobol, of course.
author: Brian Kernighan

text: A real programmer reads much more than he writes
author: Linus Torvalds

text: Speed ​​matters
author: Pavel Durov

text: When I don't know where to start, I open a blank file and write:
author: Rasmus Lerdorf

text: If your work is not documented, then you have not worked
author: Ada Lovelace

text: Writing books is harder than writing programs. Any writer can become at least a mediocre programmer. The converse is unfortunately not true.
author: Donald Erwin Knuth

text: If 20 people worked on the code, then it can be done 20 times less and 20 times faster
author: Bjorn Stroustrup

text: If Omar Khayyam lived now, he would surely be a pirate
author: Richard Matthew Stallman

text: In interviews, I usually ask if the subject uses crutches a lot. This is a good way to weed out pathological liars.
author: Steve Wozniak

text: Don't expect well-groomed nails from pioneers
author: Sid Meyer

text: You can make a fairly large project without touching the mouse at all. But why?
author: Alan Curtis Kay

text: Long distance runners win
author: Bram Cohen

text: Always start with a data structure
author: John Carmack

text: Coffee doesn't help programming, but it tastes good
author: James Gosling

text: There are no good languages, there are good programmers
author: Anders Hejlsberg

text: It's easier to wean a dog from barking at a postman than to wean an admin to work under the root
author: Ken Thompson

text: I was once naive enough, hoping that I would be good enough to learn one language
author: David Heinemeyer Hansson

text: I envy the testers: everyone wants to be friends with them
author: Andrew Tanenbaum

text: Give orders in writing: Are you a programmer, after all, or not?
author: Yukihiro Matsumoto

text: And where is your assembler now?
author: Larry Wall

text: The more experienced the programmer, the better he realizes the scarcity of his knowledge and skills
author: Chris Hughes

text: A hacker always wins a fair fight because he is dishonest
author: Eric Stephen Raymond

text: A place for an ideal code is in a museum: all sorts of antiquities are appreciated there
author: Peter Norton

text: Don't skimp on design: the end user doesn't understand programming at all
author: Dustin Moskowitz

text: It's quite difficult to manage a programmer who doesn't need money
author: Steve Wozniak

text: Learn LISP, and you won't work a single day in your life. Learn PHP, and you will still be able to earn your living
author: Richard Matthew Stallman

text: Before starting a pair programming session, remove all sharp objects from the room
author: Brendan Eich
